intro: Sloanea autanae, commonly known as the Guianan sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in countries like Venezuela, Guyana, and Suriname. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Sloanea autanae is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on tropical plant diversity and conservation.
